id: Ferry crew, Coast Guard rescue 4 boaters off NJ coast
paragraph: SANDY HOOK, N.J. (AP) — U.S. Coast Guard officials say a commercial ferry helped rescue four people from a sinking boat off the New Jersey coast.A mayday call went out just before 4 p.m. Saturday from a 21-foot pleasure boat that was taking on water near Sandy Hook Bay.The Coast Guard launched boats from its Sandy Hook and New York stations.The Coast Guard says a Seastreak ferry arrived first, and crew members helped the four people onto the ferry.Coast Guard crew members arrived a few minutes later and transferred the four people to their rescue boat before the distressed vessel capsized.All four people were wearing life jackets, and no injuries were reported.
